entry.title: Why is deriving public key from the signature not used in Segwit?
entry.summary: In an email conversation dated January 24th, 2018 at 11:16 AM, Aymeric Vitte provided a link to blockchain.info and questioned the lack of pubkey in the scriptsig. It was noted that the pubkey is actually located in the scriptPubKey of vout 0 of the transaction that it is spending, specifically 40872a376e98a1f8b285827c2ad8c5b3eec7d779d752dc3a4adda5d9bb70f3b5.
